title: 115_hr3274
content: The Act may be cited as the "President John F. Kennedy Commemorative Coin Act". John Fitzgerald Kennedy's notable achievements include serving in the Navy during World War II, being elected as the youngest President of the United States in 1960, and inspiring the creation of the Peace Corps with his call to service. President Kennedy's legacy includes inspiring the creation of the Peace Corps and challenging the US to put a man on the moon. The 100th anniversary of his birth in 2017 will be commemorated with a coin honoring his courage, service, innovation, and inclusion. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue $1 silver coins in honor of President John F. Kennedy, with specific weight, diameter, and silver content. These coins will be legal tender and considered numismatic items. The design of the coins will be determined under this Act. The design of the coins minted under this Act honoring President John F. Kennedy will symbolize his life and legacy, with specific inscriptions and values. The design will be chosen by the Secretary in consultation with relevant organizations and committees. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities from a single US Mint facility within a 1-year period starting on January 1, 2020. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. The coins will be sold by the Secretary at a price including face value, surcharge, and cost of designing and issuing. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a reasonable discount. All sales of coins issued under this Act include a $10 surcharge per coin, with the surcharges going to support the John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum. No surcharge can be included if it would exceed the annual commemorative coin program issuance limitation. The Secretary of the Treasury may issue guidance to implement this. The Secretary of the Treasury may issue guidance to implement the subsection of the Act.
